[

Stakeholder Engagement Lead - Seymour

Company Name ARTC Company Location Seymour, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 37 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Marketing / PR / Events
  • Marketing / PR / Events - Other
  • VIC Other
  • Permanent / Full Time

31/8/2018
  • Seymour, Victoria
  • Iconic Inland Rail Project - Keeping the nation moving

ARTC plays a critical role in the transport supply chain and in the overall economic development of Australia. ARTC is one of Australia's largest rail network owners.

The Inland Rail Programme is a 1710km rail infrastructure project stretching from Melbourne to Brisbane incorporating new and existing rail track. In Victoria the programme involves the enhancement of existing standard gauge track to cater for double stacking container trains.

More information relating to the project can be found here: http://inlandrail.artc.com.au.

This role is Seymour based in regional Victoria. Seymour is a historic railway township located in the Southern end of the Goulburn Valley in the Shire of Mitchell 104 kilometres north of Melbourne with a population of 6,327.

About The Position

As the Stakeholder Engagement Lead, you will be responsible for leading the development and implementation of best practice community and stakeholder engagement plans, providing advice on the approvals process, emerging issues and driving necessary solutions. You will also be involved in representing the business in community forums, developing communications materials and engaging with local government.

This is a live-in role where the successful candidate will be based within the region on a fulltime basis.

About You

To be successful in this role you will have:
  • Strong experience in stakeholder and community engagement ideally within the infrastructure, transport or logistic sectors;
  • Demonstrated issues and risk management on complex projects;
  • Ability to work with diverse stakeholders in politically sensitive environments;
  • Working knowledge and understanding of digital media and digital technologies to support community engagement
  • Demonstrated team leadership experience;
  • High level verbal and written skills including the writing and delivery of strategies, plans and communications materials;
  • Demonstrated creative thinking and problem-solving skills, with a capacity to respond to and manage changing priorities;
  • A degree in Journalism, Communications, PR or related field would be an advantage.
ARTC recognises that a talented and diverse workforce is fundamental to building a commercially strong and customer focused organisation. With your expertise and contribution, we can create a cooperative team that draws strength from our diversity and produce innovative solutions.

As part of the recruitment process, you will be required to consent to a National Criminal History Check

Appointment is subject to ARTC's medical fitness standards relative to the position. ARTC is a drug and alcohol free working environment.

If this position is of interest, please click 'Apply Now' and submit your application by close of business 14 September 2018.

Job description

Walker Hamill is a leading executive search and recruitment business specialising in placing candidates into accountancy and finance roles in Melbourne and surrounding areas. Our clients include listed Blue-Chip organisations as well as Private Equity backed small to medium (SME) sized businesses. We recruit across a broad range of sectors, on a permanent, contract and temporary basis.


We are always looking to meet strong Qualified FP&A professionals, both temporary and permanent for our clients in the Retail and FMCG sectors and are looking for candidates with experience in the following areas:


    • Supporting the annual Budget / Planning cycle, work closely with the business to develop an accurate Budget using driver based models

General Manager, Regulatory Support and Governance

Company Name Fisher Leadership (formerly Jo Fisher Executive) Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 211 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Key national regulatory leadership role
  • Drive quality vocational educational and training outcomes
  • Melbourne-based position


The primary role of the General Manager, Regulatory Support and Governance is to lead and manage the enabling programs within ASQA. As a member of the Senior Management Group, the incumbent will be responsible for supporting ASQA’s drive toward its goal of being a proactive, risk-based regulator.


Reporting to and working closely with the Commissioner, Risk, Intelligence and Regulatory Support, this key position builds relationships and linkages between the enabling and regulatory portfolios and to provide strong leadership and management to the following enabling functions:


  • Governance, Policy and Quality
  • Finance and Facilities
  • People and Culture
  • IT and Information Management
  • Communication, Education and Service Delivery


The ideal candidate will be a collaborative leader with significant senior management experience, gained in large and complex functions. The appointee will have a strategic focus and the ability to communicate with influence to drive results and build and nurture both internal and external relationships. Experience in a regulatory environment and/or the VET sector is highly desirable, as is a tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline or extensive experience in a similar role.


Australian Skills Quality Authority


The Australian Skills Quality Authority (ASQA) is the national regulator for Australia’s vocational education and training sector. Its role is to ensure nationally approved quality standards are met through the application of a risk-focused approach to regulation. ASQA’s regulation ensures that students, employers, governments and the community can have confidence in the quality of Australia’s vocational education and training.


For more information about ASQA visit asqa.gov.au


To apply\xa0– please go to fisherleadership.com and click on ‘APPLY ONLINE’ using reference ASQrsg0918, addressing your cover letter and resume to Mira Bacelj of Fisher Leadership, or call +61 1300 347 437 for further information.

Digital Learning Consultant

Company Name Latitude Financial Services Company Location Docklands, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 69 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About the Role


A newly created opportunity has become available for a forward-thinking Digital Learning Consultant to join the Organisational Capability Team. \xa0


Working in a small yet dynamic team, you will create blended learning solutions to support our face to face programs on well as support our macro and micro learning strategy. Focusing on how we use digital to simplify people's learning experiences, business wide.

Through research, you will identify, review, recommend and integrate future solutions to provide an outstanding learner experience, whilst meeting defined business and learning outcomes.


Working closely with the Learning & Development Manager your role will also be responsible for:

  • Engaging with and managing relationships with external vendors to provide digital learning content, and develop digital learning solutions, within defined budget.
  • Conduct ongoing research to ensure digital learning solutions are modern, innovative and reflective of industry best-practice.
  • SME for our Learning Management System (LMS) and support and manage all enquires.
  • Support our micro learning approach through our partnership with LinkedIn Learning to ensure optimal embedding of this tool to drive a continuous learning culture.
  • Lead our social learning approach through the implementation and governance of our social learning platform/interface to ensure this is integrated and supports enterprise wide learning needs.
  • Implementation, updating & monitoring of mandatory compliance e-learns
  • Reporting & analysis of L&D data using Microsoft Excel & relevant survey tools at a medium-advanced level for various reporting requirements.


About You


You will be obsessed with all there is to know about learning! You will curious, creative and thrive in the opportunity to create a real impact on driving our digital strategy.

You will have a minimum of 3 years’ experience in designing and implementing digital learning solutions complimented with qualifications in Learning/ Education.

Previous experience with Learning Management Systems (LMS), Workday, Cornerstone are essential, whilst experience in social collaboration platforms, graphic / multimedia design/cloud based digital learning solutions will also be highly regarded.



What are the perks?


We offer a great salary, genuine flexible working arrangements, a 5-week annual leave program, volunteer and giving programs and an extensive list of great retail and technology discounts.

Our head office in Docklands sports a subsidised caf\xe9, games room, wellness centre with a full-time nurse and spectacular customer focussed collaboration spaces. All of this enables you to bring your ambitious, authentic self to work every day.


\xa0



Note: You must be a Permanent Resident of Australia or an Australian or New Zealand Citizen to be considered for this role. Successful applicants will be required to complete a background check (including criminal history and bankruptcy check) prior to commencement of employment.

Communication Centre Manager

Company Name Computershare Company Location Abbotsford

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 153 views

Job description

Computershare (ASX:CPU) is a global market leader in transfer agency and share registration, employee equity plans, proxy solicitation and stakeholder communications. We also specialise in corporate trust, mortgage, bankruptcy, class action, utility and tax voucher administration, and a range of other diversified financial and governance services.

The Investor Contact Centre is the division within our Operations that is directly responsible for the delivery of telephone based customer services to the shareholders, investors, members or customers of Computershare’s clients. These services are predominantly inbound, but some outbound activity is required.

Correspondence is the division within the Communication Centre that is directly responsible for the delivery of specialised customer services to the shareholders, investors, members or customers of Computershare’s clients. These specialised services include written and web-chat/email correspondence.

We are looking for an experienced individual to manage our Investor Contact Centre and Correspondence teams. This role will require you to ensure the delivery of service excellence, carry out the efficient management of staff and resources, as well as take responsibility for the achievement of overall business/corporate objectives. You will work closely with Workforce Planning, Learning and Development, Recruitment and Project Teams.

Key Responsibilities (including but not limited to):

  • Providing great leadership, direction and support with a focus on staff engagement, capability development, alignment and sustainability of outputs
  • Ensuring service standards, quality standards and other service delivery metrics are met for both business as usual communication centre work and campaigns
  • Taking responsibility for identifying improvement opportunities and ensuring they are evaluated and implemented successfully
  • Building and maintaining internal and external stakeholder relationships
  • Meeting all required management responsibilities, including project management, budget management, and compliance
  • Oversee offshore team
  • Operational P&L
  • Ensuring processes and procedures are in compliance with our standards

About You:

  • Experienced in leading Contact Centre teams
  • Experience in people management; individual and team goal setting, performance management as well as coaching, mentoring and career development of staff
  • Previous client and stakeholder management experience
  • Knowledge of Contact Centre systems and telephony
  • Experience in Omni-channel and campaign management
  • Experience in process improvement initiatives
  • Experience within financial services is useful but not essential

Benefits

  • The opportunity to work for a large global corporation (over 16,000 employees)
  • Great discounts and benefits across from various companies
  • Access to our award winning Employee Share Plan

To apply click on the apply button and follow the application process.


Computershare embraces diversity and encourages applications from people with disability. Candidates will have the opportunity to request support or reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process in order to demonstrate their ability to meet the inherent requirements of the job.
